required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Urinary Protein to Creatinine Ratio in Term Pregnant Women
clinical_study.official_title: Urinary Protein to Creatinine Ratio in Term Pregnant Women: What is the Effect of a Clean Catch Urine

brief_summary.textblock: This study will determine the incidence of elevated U Pr/Cr in normal term pregnant women. In addition we will determine if a "clean catch" urine has an effect on the U Pr/Cr.

detailed_description.textblock:
Clean catch urine should be used due to possible vaginal secretion contamination with falsely elevated U Pr/Cr ratio. However, no supporting reference was found in the article and no control group with random urine collection for comparison to clean catch specimen U Pr/Cr was included in their study. The original studies that validated spot Pr/Cr urine as a predictor of 24 -hour total urine protein used random non-clean catch random urines . They had an r value of .93-.99 in estimating total protein excreted in 24 hours. At our institution we use Siemens-base test to determine U Pr/Cr. In the product insert the company states that no special patient preparation is necessary.
Thus, this study will determine the incidence of elevated U Pr/Cr in normal term pregnant women. In addition we will determine if a "clean catch" urine has an effect on the U Pr/Cr.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: PR/CR urine collected by clean catch or non -clean catch technique will be compared in term pregnancy

primary_outcome.measure: elevated PR/CR ratio using clean catch technique
primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year
primary_outcome.description: this will be the proportion of patients with PR/CR ratio greater than or equal to 0.3 in urine using a clean catch method.

secondary_outcome.measure: Report the incident of PR/CR ratio greater than 0.3
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, average of 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: overall incident of elevated PR/CR ratio in healthy term pregnant women

arm_group.description: women in this group will collect urine for PR/CR using a clean catch technique
women in this group will not employ clean catch technique

intervention.description: clean catch technique applied to collect urine for PR/CR ratio

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- women of 37 weeks gestation or greater
Exclusion Criteria:
- Urinary tract infections
- Hypertension
- Pre-eclampsia
- Renal dysfunction

eligibility.gender_description: pregnant females 37 weeks gestation or greater
